docs.snippet: The company’s board said it was suspending the chief executive, Alexander Nix, with immediate effect, pending an independent investigation.

headline.main: Cambridge Analytica Suspends C.E.O. Amid Facebook Data Scandal

docs.snippet: U.S. prosecutors on Wednesday asked a federal judge to sentence a Turkish banker convicted of helping Iran evade U.S. sanctions to about 20 years in prison, in a case that has strained diplomatic ties between the United States and Turkey.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks About 20 Years Prison for Turkish Banker in Iran Sanctions Case
headline.main: U.S. Seeks About 20 Years Prison for Turkish Banker in Iran Sanctions Case

docs.snippet: The helicopter crashed shortly after takeoff, according to residents of the town of Qaim, near the Syrian border.

headline.main: All 7 U.S. Troops Aboard Helicopter Killed in Crash in Iraq

docs.snippet: Escalating trade tensions between the United States and China may dent production of German luxury SUVs made in the U.S. South and sent to China, with exports from electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc and Ford Motor Co also vulnerable.

headline.print_headline: U.S.-China Trade War Could Hit German Automakers, Plus Tesla, Ford

docs.snippet: Ten rights groups urged French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday to use a visit by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to press him to end a blockade of Yemeni ports and work for a diplomatic solution to the conflict there.

docs.snippet: Chinese importers expecting cargoes of U.S. commodities from beef to propane said they hope to sell the goods to South Korea or Japan after Beijing's decision to slap extra tariffs on a swathe of items from agricultural products to chemicals.

headline.print_headline: China Importers Hope to Sell U.S. Cargoes to North Asia After Tariff Move
